The Four The Four
Friends and the Friends and the
Seasons Seasons
Written and illustrated by: Sarra Ben Amara Written and illustrated by: Sarra Ben Amara Written and illustrated by: Sarra Ben Amara

In the small town of Willowbrook, nestled amidst rolling
hills and colorful forests, lived four inseparable friends:
Lily, Finn, Ava, and Max. They shared a special bond,
forged through countless adventures in the ever-changing
landscapes of their town.

One brisk autumn
afternoon, as
leaves danced in
the wind and the
air was crisp
with the
promise of
winter, the
four friends
gathered
beneath the old
oak tree in the
center of their favorite clearing. They watched as
golden leaves twirled down from the branches,
filling the air with a symphony of colors.

"I love autumn," exclaimed Lily, her eyes
sparkling with excitement. "The crunch of
leaves beneath my feet, the smell of bonfires,
and pumpkin pie!"

Finn grinned, his cheeks flushed with the chill
in the air. "But don't forget about winter, Lily!
Snowball fights, sledding down the hills, and
cozy nights by the fireplace with hot cocoa."

Ava nodded in
agreement, her
scarf wrapped
snugly around her
neck. "And then
there's spring," she
added dreamily.
"The flowers
blooming, the birds
singing, and the sun
warming everything
up again."

Max, ever the
adventurous one,
chimed in, "And
let's not overlook
summer! Long days
at the lake, picnics
in the meadow, and
chasing fireflies
at dusk."

As they spoke, the seasons seemed to swirl
around them, each one bringing its own magic and
wonder. They laughed and played, embracing the
beauty of each moment as it unfolded before
them.

Days turned into
weeks, and weeks into
months, as the
friends reveled
in the joys
of the
changing
seasons. They
explored every
corner of their town,
discovering hidden
treasures and
creating memories
that would last a
lifetime.

And through it all, their friendship
remained steadfast and true, just like the
seasons that came and went, each one
bringing its own
unique charm to their beloved Willowbrook.
For in the heart of every season, they
found the truest magic of all—the magic of
friendship and the joy of shared
experiences.
